title: Southwest Charlotte shooting leaves 7-year-old dead, 3 others injured
content:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- A 7-year-old child was shot and killed Saturday in southwest Charlotte, when shots were fired at a family party, injuring two adults and another child, Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police say.
Authorities received multiple calls just before 9:00 p.m. Saturday night in the area of Fieldvale Place. When officers approached the scene, they were flagged down by family members with a 7-year-old male victim suffering from an apparent gunshot wound. Medic transported the victim, Kevin Antonio Calderon Rodas, to Carolinas Medical Center with life-threatening injuries and was pronounced dead a short time later. Two adult victims and another child were treated by Medic on the scene with non-life threatening injuries.
CMPD Deputy Chief Jeff Estes says the community has a lot of reflecting to do in the wake of this tragedy.
"It's a sad state of affairs, we have a lot of soul searching to do when as a city and a country a 9-year-old isn't safe playing in the front yard," said Estes.
At this time, the motive for the shooting is still unknown. CMPD detectives and officers are still investigating the area with K-9 units as well as aviation and gang units.
Anyone with information regarding the shooting is asked to call Crime Stoppers at 704-334-1600.
